Key Match Events: DeRozan scored a key three-pointer and step-back jumpers in the overtime periods to seal the win for the Kings.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. missed two free throws with 3 seconds left in the first overtime, allowing the Kings to tie the game and force double overtime.
Post-Match Reflections: Sacramento Kings coach Doug Christie praised the team's effort and heart, noting an improvement from previous games under the previous coach.
The game marked the second straight win for the Kings without injured point guard De'Aaron Fox.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was tied at 102 at the end of regulation and at 112 after the first overtime.
The Heat are 4-7 without Jimmy Butler this season.
Others: The game was a significant win for the Kings, extending their winning streak to a season-high five games under interim coach Doug Christie.
